title.narrative: Burkina Faso - Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: Support the establishment of a sound private, well-functioning, equitable financial sector that fulfills critical roles in a market economy, most importantly financial intermediation – the efficient generation and allocation of savings to their most productive use.

This award strives to support the establishment of a sound private, well-functioning, equitable financial sector that fulfills critical roles in a market economy. More specifically, this includes The revenue estimating project assists the Ministry of Economy and Finance's Directorate of Studies and Planning with: developing new revenue estimating software programs (models) and backup models by tax type to account for changes in tax laws and tax administration; training staff on how to modify the model to account for changes in tax laws, tax administration, and actual experience; and producing an accurate and credible revenue estimate for the Government of Burkina Faso's calendar year 2011 budget. Assist the Ministry of Economy and Finance with the implementation of program budgeting. Specifically, the advisor works with the General Budget Division on: standardizing forms, processes, and procedures; compiling a manual for use by all ministries; revising budget nomenclature and classification systems; and training budget personnel in budget analysis and performance measurement..

description.narrative: In November 2015, following more than a year of political unrest, Burkina Faso elected a new president for the first time in almost 30 years. The election, determined to be free and fair by international standards, bolstered a commitment to democracy that Burkinab demonstrated in October 2014 when a mass citizen protest brought the resignation of long-standing President Blaise Compaore. This nascent democratic step is challenged by a lack of governmental checks and balances, and public perception of inequality before the law. U.S. assistance to Burkina Faso will promote engagement by civil society with responsive local and national governments; mitigate the adverse health outcomes of malaria and other health pandemics; and continue to support the professionalization of the Burkinab military. In addition, this assistance will be complemented by a range of regionally funded USAID activities in support of economic growth, health, and countering violent extremism (CVE) goals. Burkina Faso is a key member of the Trans-Sahara Counterterrorism Partnership (TSCTP) as well as a strategic partner of the United States, promoting peace and stability throughout West Africa.
